meanings.definition: An accumulation of uncompleted work or unfilled orders.
meanings.sent1: The company had a backlog of orders waiting to be processed.
meanings.sent2: The backlog of paperwork on my desk seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent3: The backlog of emails made my inbox look like a mountain.
meanings.sent4: Her backlog of chores weighed on her mind like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The backlog of laundry in the hamper grew taller each day.

meanings.sent1: The store kept a backlog of canned goods in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent2: Having a backlog of snacks in the pantry is always helpful.
meanings.sent3: His backlog of snacks made his friends envy his stash.
meanings.sent4: The backlog of books on her shelf was a treasure trove waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The backlog of art supplies in the closet inspired her to create more.

meanings.sent1: If you don't sort the papers, they will backlog on your desk.
meanings.sent2: The dishes in the sink began to backlog after a busy week.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to backlog tasks often led to last-minute rushes.
meanings.sent4: Procrastination can cause work to backlog and become overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: Neglecting to clean the gutters can backlog leaves and cause blockages.
